channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge pothole on this road, 6th July
item.description:
The pothole has been there for years and the residents have told me they have complained several times. I was driving here and due to the pothole my car diverted left and crashed into the bushes resulting in a destroyed front bumper.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Chapter 8 barrier, 6th July
item.description:
Yellow Chapter 8 barrier abandoned on Furzefield Close, needs to be removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Furzefield Close, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree over hanging gardens, 6th July
item.description:
The tree has grown significantly and is now excessively tall and wide, resulting in: • Severe overshadowing of gardens, including my own, even during the height of summer. This blocks sunlight for most of the day, making it difficult for plants, lawns, and general outdoor enjoyment. • Impact on nearby structures and sheds, with overhanging branches coming close to rooftops and fences. • Concerns about potential damage or safety, especially during high winds or storms.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redbourne Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Intimidating religious grafiti, 6th July
item.description:
This message is regularly painted outside the front door, and inside the lift. I have removed it myself from inside the lift 4 times in the last few weeks. This is with permanent marker. Please remove immediately. This is harrassing to people living in the block.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalwood Street, Peckham, London

item.title: 6 ft high tree basal growth obscuring sightlines of schoolchildren, 6th July
item.description:
Outside No 38 Park Avenue. The extremely high and wide basal growth on the tree is obscuring drivers' sightlines of primary school children leaving Parish school backgate, who are attempting to cross this road. Please could this be removed asap. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mini roundabout road markings totally worn aeay, 6th July
item.description:

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Branch fallen from tree onto public footpath, 6th July
item.description:
A large branch from a pine tree in the grounds of the derelict grounds between no. 28 and 38-48, Park Hill Rd has fallen down, taking branches from other nearby trees (sycamore) with it. It is now partly blocking the public footpath. Some of the smaller sycamore branches have been cleared to provide safer access along the pavement, but the pine branches are still there and are leaning up against the fence but need to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
